Address.university_name: Trường Đại học Anh Quốc Việt Nam

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2009 in a small, city-centre campus in the city of Hanoi, Vietnam. The initial cohort of 20 students joined in May 2010; studying BUV developed English and foundation programmes as an approved pathway to beginning Staffordshire University (SU) degree programmes at BUV in September 2010. With its ongoing development of programmes and growth in student numbers, BUV moved to a state-of-the-art campus in Ecopark township, Hung Yen province, on the edge of Hanoi in 2018, which has a planned capacity for over 5000 students in the first two phases of its development. The university offers its own degrees as well as those awarded by Staffordshire University and University of London.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: Jan – Mar; April – Jun; Jul – Sep ; Oct – Dec
AdmissionRequirements: Completed year 12 or equivalent
IELTS score of 6
0+ (each component must score a minimum 5
5) or equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1994 following merger of four colleges located in Thai Nguyen City (the College of Engineering, founded 1965; College of Agriculture and Forestry, founded 1970; College of Education, founded 1966; and College of Medicine, founded 1968. Incorporated Vocational Training School (founded 1974); Faculty of Information Technology (2001) and Faculty of Natural Sciences (2002). TNU also includes a Regional Centre for National Defense Education. Acquired present status and title 2004.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate, and competitive entrance examination

Address.university_name: Trường Đại học Thương mại (TMU)

GeneralInformation.History: Thuongmai University (previously known as the ‘Vietnam University of Commerce’ and sometimes translated into English as the ‘Vietnam Commercial University’, or the ‘University of Commerce Vietnam’) is a public university and was established in 1960.Thuongmai University (TMU) is one of the most renowned academic institutions in Vietnam, with a long history and strong reputation of innovation in education policy, internationalisation, and research impact across management, e-commerce, supply chain management, finance tourism & hospitality and business. The University has a student-centered learning and teaching environment which enables its domestic and international students to gain a world-recognised education in a range of disciplines, with more than 20 global partner universities from France, Austria, Taiwan, Germany, USA, Canada, UK, and China across 17 international joint programs. TMU is legally recognised, is autonomous, and is 100% accredited across all its degrees by the Ministry of Education & Training (MOET), Vietnam.
